alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 5:08PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Dawson County through 615 PM MDT... At 508 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of West Glendive, or 9 miles west of Glendive, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glendive, West Glendive, Hoyt and Forest Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
